cohortName: [PL 45763653001] Fracture of bone of hip region referent concept incident cohort: First occurrence of referent concept + descendants with >=365d prior observation
logicDescription: Persons with condition occurrence of referent concept (45763653) or descendants, for the first time in the person's history. Persons exit cohort at the end of the observation period.
referentConceptName: Fracture of bone of hip region

cohortName: [PL 45763653002] Fracture of bone of hip region referent concept prevalent cohort: First occurrence of referent concept + descendants
logicDescription: Persons with condition occurrence of referent concept (45763653) or descendants, for the first time in the person's history, with at least 365 days of prior continuous observation. Persons exit cohort at the end of the observation period.
referentConceptName: Fracture of bone of hip region

cohortName: [PL 45763653003] Fracture of bone of hip region (dx + px) referent concept incident cohort (aged 50-89): First occurrence of hip fracture dx or procedure with >=365d prior observation
logicDescription:
This definition came from careful review of the following papers:
o	Ray WA, Griffin MR, Fought RL, Adams ML. Identification of fractures from computerized Medicare files. J Clin Epidemiol. 1992 Jul;45(7):703-14. PubMed PMID: 1619449.
o	Nair SS, Lenihan CR, Montez-Rath ME, Lowenberg DW, Chertow GM, Winkelmayer WC. Temporal trends in the incidence, treatment and outcomes of hip fracture after first kidney transplantation in the United States. Am J Transplant. 2014 Apr;14(4):943-951. doi: 10.1111/ajt.12652. Epub 2014 Feb 20. PubMed PMID: 24712332; PubMed Central PMCID: PMC4117735.
o	Hudson M, Avina-Zubieta A, Lacaille D, Bernatsky S, Lix L, Jean S. The validity of administrative data to identify hip fractures is high--a systematic review. J Clin Epidemiol. 2013 Mar;66(3):278-85. doi: 10.1016/j.jclinepi.2012.10.004. Review. PubMed PMID: 23347851.
referentConceptName: Fracture of bone of hip region
